Vehicle Comments:
Ultra nice and low mile 2018 goldwing! A must see!

2018 Honda® Gold Wing Tour Automatic DCT Candy Ardent Red
THE ULTIMATE PERFORMANCE TOURING MACHINE
This is a bike 43 years in the making. Rebuilt from the road up. Refined inside and out. Ready for anything. There’s a new engine. New front suspension. Available 7-speed DCT. All in a more agile body that’s over 85 pounds lighter. You’ll also find the latest in technology, including Apple CarPlayTM integration, and five distinct trim levels to suit your style. The 2018 Gold Wing is designed to push the limits of what a touring bike can be. And expand the adventure beyond anything imagined.
Features may include:
PERFORMANCE
ENGINE
The Gold Wing’s horizontally opposed six-cylinder engine is famously smooth and powerful. We’ve kept that same overall architecture, but it’s an all-new 1833cc powerplant for 2018, and over 13 pounds lighter (more than 8 pounds for the DCT versions).
ALUMINUM CYLINDERS SLEEVES
High-strength aluminum cylinder sleeves help reduce weight, increase cooling efficiency, and reduce engine length. The 73mm cylinder bore and short, high-strength crankshaft also help make the engine more compact.
UNICAM CYLINDER HEAD DESIGN
The new engine uses four-valve, Unicam® cylinder head design. That improves engine performance and power, and also contributes to the engine’s weight reduction. The four-valve per cylinder design is also a big part of the new Gold Wing’s improved fuel efficiency.
6-SPEED MANUAL TRANSMISSION
Want a manual transmission? The new Gold Wing offers the best conventional gearbox in Gold Wing history. Case in point: now you get an overdrive sixth gear.
HANDLING
DOUBLE WISHBONE FRONT SUSPENSION
One look and your eyes will immediately go to the Gold Wing’s radical, new Honda-engineered double-wishbone front suspension. The innovative design changes the path the wheel travels through the suspension stroke, and that lets us move both the engine and the rider/passenger closer to the front wheel. You get more room, and stellar handling.
FRAME
This latest generation all-aluminum frame is significantly lighter and more compact than previous editions. State-of-the-art die-casting lets us fine-tune chassis rigidity, giving you both a smooth ride and precise handling.
SWING ARM/REAR SUSPENSION
Using our proprietary single-sided Pro Arm® design, the aluminum swingarm still houses the Gold Wing’s shaft drive. The swingarm links to the frame using a new, patented pivot structure that both increases stiffness and reduces weight. You get responsive handling and a smoother ride.
ANTI-LOCK BRAKES
Have to make a hard stop, fully loaded and two up? All new 2018 Gold Wings are equipped with combined anti-lock brakes for excellent stopping power under a wide variety of road and traction conditions.
ENGINEERING
THROTTLE BY WIRE
The 2018 Gold Wing’s throttle-by-wire system affords a degree of engine control you’ve likely never before experienced. It also enables features like our power delivery modes and our exclusive Honda Selectable Torque Control (HSTC) which you’ll find on our Gold Wing Tour models.

Vehicle Comments:
A very nice rebel 500 for sale in Hillsboro Oregon with just a bit over 4K miles. Must see. The 2017 Honda Rebel 500 is a cruiser-style motorcycle that is known for its compact size, low seat height, and accessible power delivery. It features a 471cc parallel-twin engine that produces strong torque at low revs, making it easy to ride for both novice and experienced riders. The motorcycle has a classic cruiser design, with a low, forward-set footpegs and a relaxed riding position that allows for comfortable and easy maneuverability. It also has a number of modern features, including a digital instrument panel, LED lighting, and a fuel-efficient engine. The Rebel 500 is a versatile and reliable motorcycle that is suitable for both city riding and longer distance touring.

2017 Honda® Rebel 500
You don’t buy this bike. You make it yours.
The Rebel® 500 is a true triple threat: part impressive performance, part minimalist good looks and completely fun to ride. The first thing you’ll notice about the Rebel® 500 is its subtle, blacked-out looks. From the compact frame to its low-slung seat, it’s just cool. Once you get on, you’ll know immediately that this bike was meant to be ridden, thanks to an impressive lean angle, and a 471cc parallel-twin engine tuned for middle and upper-rpms. Ride it stock. Trick it out. Either way, this bike just feels right.Features may include:
SPORTY ENGINE
Twin-cylinder engines are a great choice for a machine like the new Rebel® 500. Honda twins are famous for their versatility, and the 471cc Rebel® 500’s engine is one of our best ever. The parallel-twin engine is narrow, which helps reduce overall bike size. Plus it offers lots of low-rpm torque, but plenty of higher-rpm performance.
BLACKED-OUT STYLE
The new Rebel® is a blank canvas for your self expression. But unlike the canvas you buy at the art store, this one’s not boring white. As is, its black-out engine pieces, frame, and bodywork elements look great during the day and even better at night.
LOW SEAT HEIGHT
When it comes to seat heights, almost everyone likes them lower. At just 27.2 inches, the new Rebel® has one of the lowest seats in anyone’s lineup. It’s comfortable when you ride, and it makes it easier to flat-foot it at stoplights or in parking lots.
SUPERIOR HANDLING
A lot of today’s motorcycles look great standing still, but disappoint once the road gets twisty. At Honda, we set high standards for the way all our bikes handle and feel, and the new Rebel® is a perfect example—we’ve paid just as much attention to the way this bike corners and handles as we have its knockout styling.

Vehicle Comments:
Big 4 stroke thumper!

2017 Yamaha YZ450F
MULTI MOTO SHOOTOUT WINNER
Last year’s dominant shootout-winner adds many performance-enhancing refinements for 2017 to its huge power and industry-best suspension.
Features may include:
Innovative Engine Design
The revolutionary rearward-slanted-cylinder design of the YZ450F™ allows for a straight down-draft intake with a symmetrical port layout for smooth controllable power delivery throughout the RPM range. This engine design also achieves unmatched mass centralization, for light and nimble handling.
GYTR® Power Tuner Ready
Accessory GYTR Power Tuner lets owners adjust air/fuel mixture and ignition timing maps to match engine performance characteristics to the rider and track conditions in a matter of seconds with the push of a few buttons, as well as monitor engine diagnostic codes.
Launch Control System (LCS)
LCS optimizes engine output for quicker, smoother race starts every time, boosting controllability out of the gate.
Ideal Frame Rigidity Balance
The bilateral beam frame features a carefully chosen combination of forged, cast and extruded aluminum pieces, when combined produce superior cornering traction and unmatched lightweight handling.
Class-Leading Suspension
Industry-leading, fully adjustable KYB® spring-type fork with speed sensitive damping provides exceptional balance between handling and bump absorption, for race-winning handling performance. The linkage type rear suspension features a KYB® shock with ideal damping characteristics to match the compact chassis.

Vehicle Comments:
Clean little ripper! The 2020 Honda CRF150R is a high-performance off-road motorcycle that is designed for racing. It is equipped with a powerful 150cc engine and a lightweight and agile chassis,

2020 Honda® CRF150R
Confidence Right Out of the Gate
A young rider’s first motocross bike is the moment race dreams become reality. And no bike is built to help them find success, or the podium, like the Honda CRF150R. It’s a competition quality machine, tailor-made for younger Red Riders. With a single-cylinder Unicam® engine that packs a punch, they’ll ride with confidence right out of the gate. For taller riders there’s the CRF150R Expert, with bigger wheels, a longer swingarm and higher seat. Two 150-class options to give the next generation of MX riders the strongest start possible.
Features may include:POWER
UNICAM® ENGINE
The CRF150R uses a Unicam engine based on our championship-winning CRF450R. Designed to give you excellent rideability and more power and torque across the rev range, the engine runs consistently at different tracks—it’s an all-around winner.PERFORMANCE
ACCELERATOR PUMP
The CRF150R uses a carburetor featuring a “direct push” accelerator pump which gives you better, more immediate throttle response.HANDLING
TRACK-DESIGNED CHASSIS
A lightweight, high-tensile steel frame with large-diameter frame tubing and crossmember delivers excellent turning performance and straight-line tracking.
PRO-LINK® REAR SUSPENSION
The CRF150R’s Pro-Link® rear-suspension system features a fully adjustable Showa® shock for superb bump absorption and wheel control.ENGINEERING
FRONT DISC BRAKE
The front disc brake provides powerful, precise braking.
LIGHTWEIGHT WHEELS
Strong, lightweight wheels are durable and minimize unsprung weight.STYLE
BIG-BIKE MX GRAPHICS
The CRF150R features clean, bold, bright graphics that look like our CRF450R’s. Look like a pro, ride like a pro.

Vehicle Comments:
Less than 2 hours. Clean

2020 Honda® CRF450RWE
HOLESHOT HUNGRY. PODIUM READY.
Honda’s incredible CRF450R just keeps getting better and better. And if you’re looking to dominate the 450 class, this is the bike you want. A whole selection of updates this year make the bike look and handle even better.
Then there’s the limited-production CRF450R Works Edition. The RWE gets all the improvements of the CRF450R plus a special hand-ported cylinder head, black DID DirtStar LT-X rims, a new, exclusive Yoshimura exhaust system with titanium header, titanium nitride-coated lower fork legs and shock shaft, an RK gold chain, special ECU settings, a factory-spec gripper seat, and more.
Features may include:
HANDLING
NEXT-GENERATION ALUMINUM FRAME
The CRF450R’s Next-Gen twin spar aluminum frame positions the rear shock’s mounting point lower, opening up the airbox area and contributing to a lower center of gravity for more holeshots. The frame geometry also helps improve traction, feeling and steering precision.
ENGINEERING
HRC LAUNCH CONTROL
We’re talking about a special ECU here: push the button to select the mode, hold the throttle open, release the clutch, and the CRF450R will do the rest, launching you into the first turn with a big advantage. It turns your bike into a holeshot-seeking machine!
CONVENIENCE
ELECTRIC STARTER
Kickstarting? Maybe if you’re riding in the vintage class, but not here. By ditching the kickstarter entirely, our engineers can make the CRF450R lighter. Electric starters and lithium-ion batteries are so light now and so good that putting them on a bike like this is a win/win combination. And winning is what a CRF450R is all about.
PERFORMANCE
EXCLUSIVE WORKS EDITION
Homologated for racing and available in limited numbers, the CRF450RWE Works Edition includes all the improvements of this year’s CRF450R plus a special hand-ported cylinder head, black DID DirtStar LT-X rims, an exclusive Yoshimura exhaust system including a titanium header, titanium nitride-coated lower fork legs and shock shaft, an RK gold chain, special ECU settings, black triple clamps, revalved suspension, a factory-spec gripper seat, and an HRC decal package.

title: 42016 Moto Guzzi Audace. Tastefully enhanced. Like New!
body:
Perfect condition 2016 Moto Guzzi Audace. I bought it new in April 2020 and have enjoyed it for the 1,300 miles I've ridden it, but now this monster Italian muscle cruiser is just too heavy for me (I'm 64 with injuries) because its main use is riding with my wife (combined weight of the bike, wife, and me exceeds 1,000 lbs).

https://youtube.com/shorts/iB8YvT4TQoQ

It's stock except for:
- Moto Guzzi knurled aluminum footpegs (got originals)
- Protaper genuine flat track handlebars with Domino race grips. I wanted a 1930s board track racer look.
- Solo seat that's 1.5" higher than stock (I have long legs). I bought a brand new seat and then had it built for me. I still have the original.

To me it looks really cool. The flat-track bars give it a much better look and have more leverage than stock. If you prefer the stock "dragster" bars I have them.
I trailered her to GP Motorcycles San Diego to have the first service done because there wasn't anywhere local (then rode it a little while there). It's good to go for another 6,000 miles before the next service. The Audace is a beautiful bike...a real head-turner, but she has to go to someone who can manage the weight.
PS:
- Firm on price. Its a bargain for what it is.
- There's still about $2K in finance through Piaggio/MotoGuzzi. I'll pay it off to get the title once I have a serious buyer.
- I have all receipts, OEM parts, and manual

title: 2005 KTM 525 MXC
body:
2005 KTM 525MXC

- FMF pipe
- Trail tech vapor speedo flush mounted in the bar pad.
- 3 gallon IMS tank (also comes with a stock small tank)
- Cicra hand guards
- Aftermarket larger radiators filled with Evan’s waterless coolant
- Aluminum skid plate
- Extra air filters
- Reusable Stainless steel oil filters
- Newer tires

This thing has been an awesome bike, logging many miles across the PNW. It will chug on the tight single track and will breathe fire with a twist of the wrist.

I replaced this with a new 500XCFW last year and had plans on keeping it as a spare bike, but I already have a spare bike so it’s time to let someone else enjoy it.

title: 2003 Yamaha TTR125 LE
body:
Big wheel electric start model.Low hours, like new with a shit ton of MiniMX upgrades.

I bought this from a dealer in 2006 for my ex-wife and she never really rode it. Maybe once or twice around the staging area. It was stored indoors and taken out to China Hat as a play bike a few times. Mostly ridden to chug-a-brew rock or a in a round of Moto Soccer. So, in a bout of inspiration and looking for something to do during the pandemic, I decided to splash some money on it and take it Mini Moto Racing at the Mac Track. I bought and installed everything BBR sold to make it awesome. And yet I still have not ridden it. So, it’s time for this sweet little bike to go to the next owner.

The bike probably has less than 10 hours on it total. It’s been maintained and always stored inside. I just cleaned the carb and changed all the fluids and installed a new air filter and battery. The plastics and graphics are all new. The engine is internally stock, except for a few bolt on modifications. Shit I have done to it: BBR Exhaust system, Keihin 24mm carb swap, BBR hotter spark ignition, BBR air filter and air box mods, BBR frame cradle, BBR foot pegs, BBR shifter and brake lever, BBR rear shock spring, BBR Front fork springs, BBR chain guide, BBR braided steel brake lines, BBR front bake pads, BBR rear brake shoes, billet aluminum triple clamps and fork brace, Wrenthal Fat Bars, Crycra aluminum and plastic brush guards and a brand new set of 17” Supermoto wheels with slicks ready to go to the Mac track or terrorize PDX at next year’s Alley Sweeper.

They sell new for $3500 bone stock. I am asking $3900, firm, for a very nice, low hour TTR125 with thousands of dollars of upgrades that have just been installed. The wheels and slicks alone are about $2k to purchase.

I have the California title. Cash in hand only. No low ball offers, trade, offers for drugs of any other tweeker bullshit. Seriously, don’t waste my time.

I'm selling because I just don't use it as much as I thought I would and could use the extra money right now. There are no mechanical issues!

Comments for this 2020 KTM 150 XC-W TPI:
Brayden Pfeiler Todd coming 1 31 23
2020 KTM 150 XC-W TPI
NIMBLE OFFROAD MASTER
This nimble, lightweight, extreme terrain master is all new for 2020 and now, proudly features the TPI (transfer port injection) letters next to its name. This means that there is no longer a need for re-jetting or mixing fuel, making this easy-to-shred thoroughbred even simpler to ride and work on. Already recognized for its supreme agility, the new KTM 150 XC-W TPI benefits from a brand-new frame with improved flex characteristics that, together with the many other new changes, helps elevate rider and machine to incredible new levels of competence.Features may include:
ENGINE & EXHAUST
KTM sets the benchmark in technology with its vast range of race-winning offroad competition 2-stroke models. Two years after the introduction of the world's first 2-stroke electronically controlled fuel injection offroad models, the success story continues with completely reworked, new generation offroad competition engines, all fitted with the revolutionary TPI system. This now also includes the KTM 150 XC-W TPI, further demonstating KTM's unrelenting commitment to 2-stroke advancement. The benefits are clear: besides huge improvements in fuel efficiency and exhaust emissions, the system also removes the need for pre-mixing fuel and re-jetting, meaning that with less effort, the engine always runs smoothly and crisply.
CHASSIS
When it comes to 2-stroke weaponry, keeping weight down is key. It should come as no surprise then that the KTM 150 XC-W TPI is one of the lightest, slimmest and most agile offroad machines in its class.
ERGONOMICS & COMFORT
Designed for complete harmony between rider and bike, KTM has exploited the knowledge from decades of race success to create perfect ergonomics on the KTM 150 XC-W TPI. Maximum rider comfort and movement in all conditions is guaranteed. Additionally, the bike features a new tail light design which fits perfectly to the new shape of the rear fender and the number plate carrier.
BODYWORK & GRAPHICS
With input from KTM's factory riders, as well as KTM R&D and Kiska Design, the new bodywork of the KTM 150 XC-W TPI pushes the boundaries of progression even further. The result is a shape across the entire range, that achieves complete harmony between rider and bike. The main goal was to provide the optimal contact points that allow a rider maximum freedom of movement and improved handling. The front and rear fenders feature an intelligent I-beam design, guaranteeing maximum stability with the lowest possible weight. A new tail light design fits perfectly to the new shape of the rear fender and the number plate carrier. The new in-mold graphics confirm the high-performance intentions of this bike, as well as KTM's never-ending quest for race-winning progression.
SOFTWARE & ELECTRONICS
KTM XC-W TPI models feature the most modern engine management system of any 2-stroke off-road motorcycle. By reading various sensor data inputs, such as intake and ambient air pressure, throttle valve position and water temperature, the control unit optimizes ignition timing and the amount of fuel to inject at all altitudes and conditions.

title: 1979 Yamaha SR500 (Trades Welcomed and OBO )
body:
This is a 1979 Yamaha SR500. There largely hasn’t been a part on this bike that hasn’t been overhauled, improved, or upgraded. This motorcycle is very fun and fast. It’s rare that I’m not approached when out riding and given some sort of compliment. I spent a lot of time on this bike and would be sad to see it go. I’m posting to gauge interest and to investigate the possibility of trades. Interested in trading for sport bikes, modern dirt bikes, toy haulers, trailers, classic cars or trucks. Would be also be very interested in a 2009-2012 Honda CRF450R.

title: 2020 KTM 790 Rally
body:
2020 KTM 790 Rally for sale.
Only 408 miles!
Like new showroom condition.
Only 500 of these were produced worldwide with only 80 or so making it to the U.S.
KTM's are known for being rather tall and hard for many riders to feel comfortable on. This Rally would be perfect for a person that has struggled with tall bikes.
This KTM has the sought after Cone Valve suspension ( $6,500 upgrade ) that has been lowered 1 3/4" by Solid Performance.
The setup performs extremely well off road with professional tuning and valving.
Set up for a 185lb rider. I rode it on Sunday 10/20/22 in the boise front. I'm 165lbs without gear and the suspension worked flawlessly thru the woops on trail and gravel roads.
Other than my ride on Sunday I do not believe this bike has ever been offroad.
Perfect for a rider that is 5' 6" - 5' 10"
First service has been performed so you don't have to do anything but ride it for the next 8500 miles.
I suggest checking the air filter after every ride in the dirt.
Extras include a lower Seat Concepts seat bar risers and a Billet case guard. Has quick shift + and Rally Mode installed. Otherwise the bike is stock.
There is a scuff on the left side tank guard from the previous owner. Looks like a parking lot tip over.
No other scuffs or scrapes on the bike.
This bike will not disappoint!

Please don't waste my time with stupid questions and lowball offers. No test rides without endorsement and agreed selling price cash in hand. No off road test rides. I do not need help selling this bike. Wholesalers leave me alone. A text or email with " is it still available " will be considered spam.

2022 KTM 200 Duke
LIGHT HEAVYWEIGHT
Thanks to an ultra-compact single-cylinder 4-stroke power plant and a lightweight tubular chassis, the KTM 200 DUKE packs a mighty punch. An updated predatory design proudly displays its BEAST-inspired DNA and shouts DUKE. Make no mistake - the KTM 200 DUKE is an out-and-out street prowling brawler.
Features may include:
ENGINE & EXHAUST
Engine
Powered by a powerful single-cylinder engine, the KTM 200 DUKE not only delivers intoxicating acceleration but also everyday rideability. Boasting 19 kW (26 hp), it's the most powerful 4-stroke option in its class. Thanks to an updated airbox and exhaust, it meets the highest emission and noise standards, while providing maximum performance.
CHASSIS
Upside-down fork
The KTM 200 DUKE comes with ultra-lightweight, high-performance upside-down WP forks as standard. Using the latest technology, these forks not only perform flawlessly when pushed to the limit, but also allow riders to cruise comfortably on longer stretches of tarmac.
ERGONOMICS & COMFORT
Seats
The two-part seat offers first class sport riding ergonomics with maximum support for both rider and pillion.
BODYWORK & GRAPHICS
Design
There's no denying the KTM 200 DUKE is 100% DUKE. Its aggressive-looking headlight, READY TO RACE stance and sharp lines make it a formidable presence on any street.
SOFTWARE & ELECTRONICS
ABS
Single channel BOSCH ABS comes as standard on the KTM 200 DUKE. This means you can ride assured knowing that should you have to brake hard and suddenly - the DUKE has your back.

title: 2018 Husqvarna FE350
body:
2018 Husky FE350 street legal dual sport in perfect condition! 4 stroke thumper! Fuel injected, so no carb issues ever!! Current registration to 4/2024 and clean clear title in hand. Zero issues! I am 2nd owner, 1st owner was a race mechanic, bike is perfect! Bike is set up and ready to to run the 500 mile Barstow to Vegas ride! It’s ready for anything! All new plastics and custom graphics, Scott’s steering damper. ($800), HDB brush guards with foldable mirrors ($300), Scott’s lifetime reusable stainless oil filter ($80), P3 carbon exhaust heat shield ($125), auto tuner-race mode, good tires, a huge box full of goodies (heated grips, almost anything for future maintenance, too much too list/must see). $8000 firm, as it’s set up and bullet proof! There is nothing else like it out there.
Also have a 1000lb rated double hitch carrier, with extra welded brackets for anti sway.
Also have all riding gear, all fairly new and top name brands (gear bags, boots, helmets, gloves, body armor, etc) if needing.
MUST SEE, HEAR, TOUCH! You will know asap how epic it is. Must have cash in hand and motorcycle endorsement to test ride. Local in person deals only. This one is SPECIAL! Unexpected last minute move forces sale.

I took it to Cascade Motorsports last winter for a service and told them to fix anything they find wrong. They resealed front forks, fixed a fuel leak, flushed front and rear brake fluid, changed oil, did a tune-up.
After I got it back from them I replaced front and rear pads and rotors, replaced both sprockets and chain and air filter. I have a K&N filter for it but I run a stock one.

Comes with stock seat, low windshield, Giant loop Siskou around the world panniers, KTM hard panniers, KTM tank bag, extra sprockets, and some smaller soft bags. Last sept took it on a 1,000mile 3 day ride to the Redwoods and did great. Just bought a ‘22 KTM 690.

Bike is in great shape, no issues.

body: Brand New Talaria Sting electric dirt bikes in stock! Available in crate, or assembled and ready to ride and fully charged! These are similar to the surron / sur-ron electric dirt bikes, but have a longer range, and slightly different geometry. We have these in stock, assembled and ready to rip!

title: 2005 ROAD KING CLASSIC 30,500 miles
body:
I hate to let it go this cheap but Harleys aren't holding their value like they used to. Beautiful Lava Red! REALLY POPS!
My Harley is a 2005 with about 30,500 miles. I've put the last 20K miles on it trouble free!
I'm the second owner, first was Gene Walker of Salem's old Harley dealer "WALKERS HARLEY DAVIDSON"
Built 88 to 96-103 cubic inches. Gene Walker wouldn't say, just winked!
This baby runs excellent! Roland Sands design air filter. If the handlebars are too much, I have the stock ones. I put the python mufflers on, it's not so loud and I've had lots of compliments on the way they sound.
Three plug oil change every spring. Fresh oil and filter waiting in a box for next season. The saddle bag guards are upgraded to the next generation, they pull back more and not so much against the passenger calf.
Many different looks on this Road King. I don't have the white solo seat anymore. Comes with a lot of extras.
Title in hand.


Call or text me at nine71three88five02seven for more information.
Thanks for looking!

title: *CLASSIC* 1977 BMW R100/7
body: Great old airhead that's one of those bikes that we all want to own at least once, the classic black BMW look is one of a kind! I'm the 3rd owner of this beauty, just installed new Avon Road Rider MKII tires! Paint is very good, the handlebars, mirror and grips are not OEM, were put on by the PO. Mufflers are in terrific shape, no rust or pitting in the chrome, the headers show the usual color change, rims and spokes also in good shape, almost new petcocks, fuel lines and filters, crash bars/engine guards, runs and rides well, will do 65mph all day! I have some original paperwork, as well as a small notebook with OG owner's maintenance notes. Included in the sale are a Luftmeister fairing, luggage rack with an Arthur Fulmer fiberglass top box, padded passenger backrest, and of course, Krauser hard bags too! Only the Krauser bags are currently mounted, all needed hardware to mount other extras are here, just didn't want to for myself. As seen in the photos, seat has been custom reupholstered, fork boots were removed before I bought her. Minor oil leaking from pan gasket, fresh fluids all around. Worried about the mileage? the bike is 46 years old, that's less than 2k per year! I have another boxer with over 78k miles, treat them right, they keep going and going! Tags are expired, clean title in hand. $4500, come by and take a look at her! Reply by email, please leave name & phone number. No help needed selling, no shipping, cash only sale.

title: 1983 Honda Goldwing GL1100 full restomod
body:
Finished this project Fall of 2022 after 3 years and 250+ hours of labor in my garage. I am moving out of state for a new job and can't take it with me. This bike is 100% ready for everyday riding after a fresh overhaul. I've ridden about 750 miles in the last 5 months to reliability test it and work out any bugs. It's good to go.

This is a 1983 Honda Goldwing GL1100 Aspencade which has had the following work completed:

New valve cover gaskets
New timing belts
New timing belt cover gaskets
Replaced instrument cluster bracket
Aftermarket headlights and tail lights
LED integrated stop light/blinkers rear
LED blinkers front
Complete brake caliper rebuild with new seals x3
New front master brake cylinder
Rear master brake cylinder rebuilt
New brake pads
High temp engine enamel respray
Carburetor rebuild
Fuel tank flush
New fuel hoses
New fuel filter
Cooling system descaling and multiple flushes
Fresh oil and filter
Fresh coolant
New radiator hoses
New seat
Refurbished speed sensor gear
Fresh gear oil + seals
Wiring harness overhauled and reconditioned
Compressor delete
Plastics respray
Full frame respray
Exhaust respray
New battery
New air filter
Manual fan switch added
New fork dust covers
New fork oil
Custom rear foot pegs

Comes with a big box of parts (extra brake pads, fuel and oil filters, OEM rear footpegs, printed manual, large scale wiring diagram, and other miscellanea.

I also have the rear side boxes and mounting frame but they are in original unrestored condition. I did not install them to save weight and achieve a cleaner look.

Runs great, comfortable ride and fairly quiet (stock exhaust).
15,6XX original miles on the engine, ready for the next 100k. Does not leak anything.

Many hours of detail work in this project. There isn't a component (excluding internal engine components) that has not received the attention it needed.

title: 2003 Goldwing Trike (by Roadsmith) REDUCED
body:
Yes. . . You read it right. 2003 Goldwing Trike (by Roadsmith) with only 45209 miles. $18K takes it (we might consider reasonable offers). Only 200 miles were put on it since it's service. It was purchased to be my wife's ride but she never used it. I just keep it charged up and start it up every once in a while to keep the gaskets up to speed. Always garaged and kept covered (which comes with it) and we're a non smoking household (not that it matters).

I had it serviced for her November 2021 which included. . . full lube, synthetic oils, progressive fork springs and fork seals and now it needs a new home. It runs great and has a 1832cc 6 cylinder engine that runs on regular or premium gas and a 5 speed manual transmission. I've got to say that the back seat is extremely comfortable. And yes. . . it does go if you want it to.

The pictures will tell you a lot of the story.

Give me a call or text if you have any questions.

Lance 5 4 one 4 2 zero 9 one 9 three


If the ad is still up then it's still available. Oh yeah. . . I don't need help selling it and let's not play the email game. This isn't my first rodeo (if you know what I mean).

Thanks for looking.

call or text me

body:
A souped up mini bike from the 70s. Tons of torque (does wheelies) and just needs some working brakes to ride safely.

- Nearly brand new Tires

- Powder coated frame, no rust.

- Custom seat with suspension

- Original chrome fenders.

- Heat wrapped exhaust pipe

- Upgraded front fork springs

I bought this bike a couple of years ago for $500 in terrible shape, put roughly $1600 and much labor into it but I really just don't have the means to take it out riding anymore. It was fun to fix though. Starts and runs well but it a bit finicky to cold start but it's easy once you learn. Selling at a huge loss but that's just what the market is asking right now.

title: Rokon Ranger 2018
body:
2018 Rokon Ranger

Need cash, Title in Hand.

I paid $6,500 last year and put $500 into it. New slip clutch pulley, rear chain, belt. It worked perfectly the first few rides then something knocked loose going over bumpy snow.

The high gear isn’t engaging correctly, could be the carb needs to be cleaned or perhaps there’s a sheared roll pin based on advice from Rokon forum members. Should be a very simple fix but I have no clue what I’m doing. It still runs and goes but doesn’t climb or get up to gear the way it did.

Bummed to be selling but it’s not getting use right now. I bought it used. Previous owner built the customized the basket. Included in purchase are original camo seats and all lights needed for street legal.

title: 2008/11 KLR 650 (685)
body:
Yup another KLR. However, I doubt you'll find one as deeply modified as my beloved and storied Grendel. This has been my commuter, adventurer and farkle focus for . . . Ten years? Too many bikes in the garage, time to pass it along to someone with similar tastes.
I bought it as a garage queen from the original owner. Over the last 70k I have squashed all the bugs and added all the farkles. A big bore kit and a truly waterproof dual USB port are deserving of special mention. About all it needs is a supercharger. This bike has, and continues to perform flawlessly. True to the KLR mission it doesn't specialize in anything, but it will do everything. A week on pavement in the Southwest or a week on technical trails between here and Truckee. Whether it's gravel roads on Marys Peak or cow trails over to Summer Lake, this bike can do it. The only time it ever let me down was for a factory recall on an electrical short, now sorted.
It is currently set up for my 34 inch inseam, but the stock links are available. There are a couple extra windshields, the stock seat, and my custom attempt at a more comfortable seat. Along with a pile of extra bits. There is also an actual Kawsaki shop manual. I'll even throw in my old torque wrench.
If your looking for flash this isn't your bike. If a bombproof, reliable bike that'll get you places you never expected is more your speed, KLR is the way to go.
As with a fuzzy puppy I'd like to see Grendel go to someone who will take care of it. Whether or not you appreciate the genius of it is up to you. This bike is ready for another 75k, and I'm more than happy to help the new owner work on it and or answer questions, if needed. Endorsement and cash gets you a test ride.



Air/Fuel
- K&N Air Filter (Came with bike at 3700mi)
- L-Mod on Airbox (Some time after 3700)
- DynoJet 146 Main Jet (32680 – 155, 38491 - 150)
- DynoJet Needle (32680)
- Drilled Slide
- Socket Head S.S. Bowl Screws
- Shortened Main Straw
- Gutted Petcock (No vacuum needed)
- Fuel Line
- Idle Fuel/Air Mixture Knob
- Moved Choke to Starter Solenoid Cover (37563)
- DG O-Series Slip On Exhaust with Quiet Core (28573)
Suspension/Wheels
- Dunlop Trailmax Mission
- Anodized Black Front Rim HD Spokes (Woody’s?)
- Cogent Dynamics Moab Rear Shock
- Cogent Dybamics progressive fork springs with DDC
- Russell S.S. Front/Rear Brake Line (26244)
- Prevailing torque countershaft nut (no more folding washer)
- Acerbis Supermoto Front Fender
- Eagle Mike Fork Brace
- Eagle Mike Raising Links (stock available)
Engine
- Eagle Mike Doohickey and Torsion Spring
- Kibblewhite Valve seals (55k)
- Schnitz Racing 685 Kit (55k)
- Ricochet aluminum Skid Plate
- NGK Irridium Spark Plug (DPR8EIX) (47448 and 55k)
- Thermo-Bob II (47948)
- Motion Pro Extended Clutch Cable (49095)
Farkles
- Twin VisionX LED Headlight (Lights replaced 2Feb21) (39422 - DIY bracket)
- JNS Engineering Aux Light Bracket (47918)
- KLRdash.com Upper Dash

title: 2020 Husqvarna Svartpilen 701 (KTM690)
body:
At 355lbs this beautiful (bronze/grey/black?) bike really rips. Built on the KTM 690 platform this single is the largest ever put in a street bike. Turn off the T/C and it's a wheelie monster and even 4th gears torque will push you back.

It's an urban legend but really shines in the twisties and absolutely rips up Mary's peak. 0-60 MPH time of 3.6 seconds.
80/20 tires and a bit more suspension travel than it's brother the Vitpilen gives it some fire road abilities.

I absolutely LOVE this bike but my girlfriend hates the pillion seat so I'm shopping sport tourers.

Leo Vince exhaust with db killer
Barend mirrors (originals kept along with bar ends)
Puig windscreen
Husqvarna Tank bag
Service current
Bar risers (uninstalled as of yet)

Pro's- Pulled like a slingshot -- monster single gives amazing torque through rev range -- So light it's incredibly easy to turn and maneuver -- KTM engine (legend)/frame are reused in a ton of bikes and parts interchange -- Brakes

Con's -- lack wind protection, even with tiny windscreen -- light weight less pleasant in highway wind wash - NOT a begginer bike -- Mid/high seat height

Upgrade from your learner 401 and you'll be blown away (off the back)!

title: 2017 Honda CRF450R
body:
Looking to sell my 2017 CRF450R. I am the only owner of this bike and I have a clean title for it. This bike is completely stock with custom graphics kit that can be peeled off if desired.

It has very low hours (less than 40) as I only took this bike out a maximum of 6 times while I was living in Hawaii. Oil changes every two rides, and washed it after every ride (the Hawaii clay will stain everything.) Just ended up being to much bike for what I was wanting to do and now I'm looking to get something that is street legal. Just got it looked at from a local shop and appraised by them and I feel comfortable asking $6000 obo.

Just gave it a fresh wash and it has always been garage kept.

Will consider trades but only for street legal dual sports. Thanks for looking.

title: 2020 KTM 790 Rally
body:
2020 KTM 790 Rally for sale.
Only 408 miles!
Like new showroom condition.
Only 500 of these were produced worldwide with only 80 or so making it to the U.S.
KTM's are known for being rather tall and hard for many riders to feel comfortable on. This Rally would be perfect for a person that has struggled with tall bikes.
This KTM has the sought after Cone Valve suspension ( $6,500 upgrade ) that has been lowered 1 3/4" by Solid Performance.
The setup performs extremely well off road with professional tuning and valving.
Set up for a 185lb rider. I rode it on Sunday in the boise front. I'm 165lbs without gear and the suspension worked flawlessly thru the woops on trail 4 and gravel roads.
Other than my ride on Sunday I do not believe this bike has ever been offroad.
Perfect for a rider that is 5' 6" - 5' 10"
First service has been performed so you don't have to do anything but ride it for the next 8500 miles.
I suggest checking the air filter after every ride in the dirt.
Extras include a lower Seat Concepts seat bar risers and a Billet case guard. Has quick shift + and Rally Mode installed. Otherwise the bike is stock.
There is a scuff on the left side tank guard from the previous owner. Looks like a parking lot tip over.
No other scuffs or scrapes on the bike.
This bike will not disappoint!

$21,500 OBO
Please don't waste my time with stupid questions and lowball offers. No test rides without endorsement and agreed selling price cash in hand. No off road test rides. I do not need help selling this bike. Wholesalers leave me alone. A text or email with " is it still available " will be considered spam.

title: Harley Davidson Slim
body:
2015 Harley-Davidson FLS - Softail Slim, Super low Seat Height!

The perfect blend of classic, raw bobber style and contemporary power creates a modern ride with unmistakable old-iron attitude.

Features Include:
Hidden Rear Shocks
If you want a comfortable bike but love that rigid-suspension look, you've come to the right bike. Harley kept all the modern comforts where they belong—below the surface of a rad, vintage-looking bike. You get the classic lines of a vintage 'hardtail' frame with the horizontal rear shocks hidden in the guts. It's a signature rigid look, and you'll only find it on this Softail model.

"Hollywood" Handlebars and "Cat Eye" Console, with color fuel tank monitor and heat cover oil cooler
A cutting-edge ride that's rich with Harley-Davidson history, the Softail Slim model's old-iron soul comes alive right up front. Unique retro-inspired handlebars call back to the glory days of 1940s bobbers, while the gloss-black headlamp cover and the "Cat Eye" console with its retro speedo face add even more swing-era swagger.

Narrow Rear Profile
The narrow rear tire and chopped fender with its integrated stop/turn/tail light and side-mounted license plate add up to a stripped-down profile that evokes the iconic, no-nonsense style of classic bobbers. Including long shot exhaust pipes for that deep throat sound.

Round Air Cleaner Cover
The gloss-black retro round air cleaner cover gives the Softail Slim® model's minimalist, blacked-out Twin Cam 103 Engine a raw old-school look—it's modern power with old iron attitude.

Pure Harley-Davidson Styling
Feast your eyes on the Twin Cam 103™ engine and there's no mistaking its roots. This is authentic Harley-Davidson style through and through with an attention to detail you won't find from any other motorcycle company. Medium gray engine with black powder-coated cylinders and cylinder heads are topped off with polished rocker covers and an old school round air cleaner cover for a tough vintage Harley-Davidson attitude. It's a jewel machined out of metal. Pure. Dripping with power. From the classic edge of the cooling fins to the clean lines of cases and covers—the Twin Cam 103™ engine makes an ironclad statement about holding on to what's right and staying true to what satisfies

Comments for this 2015 Honda CBR500R:
2015 Honda CBR500R
Middleweight. Never Middle Of The Pack.
Honda boldly redefines the middleweight class and infuses a whole new level of excitement for sport riders in search of superior value, along with great fun.
The CBR 500R delivers plenty of performance to sport riders, with its thoroughly modern, torquey 471cc P-twin DOHC engine wrapped in a great-handling chassis and featuring a full fairing spawned from Honda's much-acclaimed CBR 600RR and CBR 1000RR sportbikes.
The CBR 500R features a full bodywork cowl and a 31-inch seat height. It's an excellent choice for riders ready to move up a displacement class, or for any rider who's looking for a light, sporting, do-it-all street machine.
Features May Include:
Enough Engine For Everything
Choosing a 500 isn't a compromise, especially when it's a powerplant with as much development behind it as Honda's parallel twins. Liquid-cooling, double overhead cams and bulletproof reliability make this a great all-around powerplant for any kind of riding you have in mind.
Sporting Heritage
The CBR 500R offers a riding position that's a touch more sporty, but not too aggressive, whether you're commuting or carving the canyons.
Practicality was never so much fun.
Its combination of lightweight and rider-friendly engine makes the CBR 500R a great choice for commuting, weekend rides, or just getting out and having fun. Plus, its lower seat height makes it easier to get your feet on the ground when you stop.
Accessorize Your Style
The CBR 500R has a full line of available Honda Genuine Accessories including a sport screen, color-matched passenger seat cowl, and carbon-look accents.

2023 Kawasaki KLX®230SM

COMFORTABLE ERGONOMICS

Bright LED headlight

title: Harley Davidson 1200 Sportster
body: All original 1998 Harley-Davidson 1200 Sportster. Like-new condition. Very fun and easy to ride. Sounds great - not too loud. Extremely low miles. Price is firm.

title: Honda CRF150R
body:
Honda CRF150R Liquid cooled Motocross dirtbike. This is NOT the RB large wheel model. Excellent condition and well maintained. Two rides on new tires, chain and sprokets and chainguides. Has Fastway spark arrester cap that can be easily removed for the track. Handguards. Extra plugs, airfilters,oil filters, and oil. Valves recently checked and all is well. Runs fantastic and the bike rips. My kid has just moved up to next size. Clean Idaho title. No trades.



CR, CRF, KTM, Husquvarna, Motocross.

title: 2013 KTM 350 EXC-F
body: Price reduced $5995.00….= 2013 KTM 350 EXC-F. Ready for the road and off-road. Just serviced at KTM in Eugene, New tires (front/back) MotoZ tires, fluids changed etc., Oversized fuel tank, tank bag, rear luggage brackets, handlebar grip heaters, folding mirrors, upgraded headlight, factory lowered, upgraded foot pegs, Corbin Seat, too much too list, everything works great…..odo 06793 miles. Looks and runs like new. Only selling because I haven’t had time to ride it so it’s been setting in an enclosed garage. No trades. Clear title with good Oregon plates. Note: NO email response if your interested just call me. If the ad is up its still for sale.

title: 1973 FLH harley Davidson
body: Beautiful 1973 FLH with original sprung seat. 1200cc, 4 speed. Runs great. All numbers matching.

title: 2015 KTM 65sx + paddle tire
body:
Great running 65sx with a new tire, clutch, and top end installed just 5-10 miles ago by Gray Area KTM.
FMF spark arrestor muffler.
The motorcycle hasn't been used in the dunes yet, but we did buy a second wheel with a paddle tire that is included.


Prior to our time, the radiator was dented by turning the handlebars too far with the frame-stop removed. The frame stop is back in place and the handlebars don't touch the radiator.
There is no title for this bike.

title: 2007 kx 450f
body: 2007 kx 450 new grips, LEX silencer, fork seals and new seat cover. Always very reliable and runs great.

title: UBCO 2x2 Adventure
body:
2X2 Adventure Bike - Available in Black or White

Designed in New Zealand but Assembled right here in Eugene Oregon!

Road registrable and ready for adventure, on- and off-road. Perfect for the urban commuter who dislikes traffic jams and the weekend adventurer who enjoys the sounds of nature. No motorcycle endorsement needed to ride a 2x2!

Take a test ride without moving an inch.
https://ubco.com/pages/virtual-test-ride
Prefer to feel the wind on your face? Book a test ride with us today at our Eugene factory.

Specifications
Dual wheel drive
30mph Top speed
50-75mi Range
4-6 hours ﻿Charge time (Includes Fast Charger)
DOT approved hydraulic brakes & regenerative braking operate together.

17×1.85” aluminum rims (DOT compliant) wheels.
17×2.75” multi-use tires, balanced between street performance and off-road grip.

Payload (incl. rider): 330lbs
Front and rear racks standard.
19 drop forged attachment lugs on subframe & rack for attaching accessories.

130mm front suspension.
120mm rear suspension.
Preload & rebound adjustment.

Under the flip up seat we also provide a tool kit and a full user manual standard like they used to do in the old days when you got a motorbike.

Battery comes in 2 sizes with different capacities (ie. range)
KxH 3100 Watt hours (61.2Ah) -ADV with 3.1 is $5,999
or
KxH 2100 Watt hours (40.8Ah) -ADV with 2.1 is $4,999
both drop into the frame and can be removed from the bike to charged or quickly swapped for more riding time.
50 volt nominal

Best part is our factory warranty is 1 year full coverage on the frame and drivetrain and 2 years on the battery.
Financing is available for $130/month.
Come by the factory for a test ride here in Eugene, tell them Clayton sent you!

title: 2014 Yamaha FJR 1300
body: 2014 Yamaha FJR 1300; brand new tires; new brakes; garage kept; regularly and fully maintained; two owners; 16,750 miles; heated handles; some scratches; beautiful ride.

title: 2019 KTM 450 sx-f
body:
2019 SXF-450, 90 hrs.
Case protector, kick stand, extended range fuel tank…
and much more, See pic.
Serviced at Gray Area KTM, including all manufacturer recommends like front shocks, etc.

No trades

title: 2014 Honda CTX 700N
body:
2014 Honda CTX 700N

7,000 miles

Excellent condition. Always garaged. Stock with exception of sporty tank grippers and zip on seal savers.

Recent new gel battery. (Excellent for cold weather) Has had regular service. (Oil and filter changes, brake fluid, chain adjustment and regular lubing)

title: 2018 BMW K1600B Low Miles and Beautiful!
body: Hello, If you are interested in this bike then you probably already know something about it but if not read the reviews. Everybody who rides bikes should own a six cylinder BMW at one point. It has 165hp and 129 ft. pounds of torque with the Remus exhaust and is turbine smooth. I’ve owned over 50 Street motorcycles and this one is probably the best. I’m only selling it because I like to try new things but I will definitely own another one. You may be able to find another for little less money but if you buy one and then add the extras that makes this a better bike it adds up. It has under 6400 miles. It has a GPS and every factory option from BMW including the option 719 forged wheels. They probably don’t add anything to the performance of the bike but they sure look cool. I haven’t checked with Bmw but my dealer said only one in 20 B models are ordered with them because of their expense. If you want to put them on a bike after purchase they are over $4500. The Remus exhaust was $2600. Expensive but it sounds so awesome once you hear it it’s another item you’ll really want. Not too loud at cruising speeds but just a much more aggressive tone. IMO the B model come with one of the worst stock seats of any bike I’ve owned especially such an expensive one. The Sargent seat I added was over $900 but makes the bike rideable all day. And it’s getting better every mile. I’ve owned several Gustafsson windscreens and they are my favorite. The one they offer wasn’t as wide as I wanted so I sent them a template to custom make me one. It turned out great. With the BMWs electric windshield you can raise and lower it to the perfect position for your body and weather. I recently installed some Metzeler Road-Tec 01 tires in the HWM (heavy weight motorcycle) version. Another big improvement. It’s had a recent synthetic oil change and is cross country ready. I have saddle bag luggage. I have the pricey factory cover that’s never been out of the box. I also have the BMW GS 911 diagnostic tool which I’ve never used. All this adds up to a bike you don’t have to add anything to or maintain for a long time. If you buy a bike that needs tires maintenance etc. plan on thousands out of pocket. I have the stock exhaust, windscreen and seat. The bike is in awesome condition. No tipovers. Title is in my hand. I may be interested in trading for a 2020 or newer low mileage Indian. Please no Craigslist Scams. I’ve heard them all. And no test rides without money in my hand. Bike is too expensive. Thanks for looking!

title: 2021 Yamaha 700 Tenere Adventure Bike
body:
Selling my lightweight Yamaha Tenere 700 adventure bike. It's in brand new condition and comes with a transferable 48 month warrantee, good until June of 2025. Features nice rear and side luggage racks, compact, High-Tech Engine that combines exceptional reliability and exciting power in a compact, fuel-efficient package. The 689cc fuel-injected, liquid-cooled, DOHC inline twin gives this bike more power and improved fuel economy while the counterbalanced two-cylinder design provides smooth, long-legged power and exceptional handing. A lightweight, high-strength tubular steel frame provides a tuned rigidity balance for nimble, responsive handling with the strength and durability needed to tackle the harshest terrain with confidence. The chassis utilizes a short 62.6-inch wheelbase for agility and boasts 9.5 inches of ground clearance to tackle whatever the trail throws at you. The narrow body and fuel tank also enable the rider to grip the tank whether sitting or standing, giving added confidence whether you're riding on dirt or asphalt. The adventure-ready suspension utilizes a long-travel 43mm inverted fork with 8.3 inches of travel. The beefy inverted layout is highly resistant to flex to maintain precise steering and suspension action, and the fork is fully adjustable to match changing road and trail conditions. The linkage-type rear shock is similarly outfitted for adventure, with 7.9 inches of travel, and a remote preload adjuster to easily fine tune for changing loads or riding conditions.
Asking $12,500 OBO

title: 1989 Kawasaki Zx7 Ninja H1
body:
Hi selling, my 1989 zx7. Bought bike 2 years ago. Was going to convert to a track bike, it’s seemed in much worse when I bought it. It cleaned up too nice, and I didn’t want to wad it up at ORP. Plus, it would take some more substantial upgrades for that that kind of riding. So I’ll keep the track bike I already ride. Runs well, has mega cycle cams, and IMO one of the best looking pipes out there.
Also in town riding 2nd gear will neutral if steady throttle held at 7k and above. No effect when riding normal or high speeds/redline shifting.
Sweet 90’s marker lights(not really). Just installed a used rear inner fender, and need to get some turn signals. Instrument cluster is missing the high beam indicator. Upper front fairing is aftermarket. The rest of plastics are oem, in good shape and both sides have had repairs done.

The goody goods:
All lights work.
Mega cycle cams. Installed by og owner. Top end screams with open supertrapp is fantastic. But run 6 discs for more midrange. Next on my list, was going to be factory pro jet kit. Currently dynojet.
Gas tank is lovely inside. Outside good shape, Ding on top and does have an aftermarket fuel filler.
New fuel lines and filter
Rebuilt Petcock
Kawasaki fuel pump relay
iridium plugs
OEM air filter
Stock air box/ spare air box included
Head bearings greased
Forks rebuilt
Front mstr cyl rebuilt
SS brake lines
Yzf600r shock w/remote reservoir. Better than the og, but still a kidney buster.
Rear suspension bearings, pivot pints cleaned and greased.
Supertrapp exhaust Beautiful
DID 525 VX3
AFAM rear sprocket
Superlight front sprocket
New s21 rubber
New bar grips
Coolant bottle was replaced(oem) when it slid out on the right side.
Used good shape oem clip ons
New oem grips(new packaging)
Spare alt/gen belt
EBC clutch plates(new in box)


Thanks
Randy 802-777-8177 Eugene OR
Call or text. I never look at my emails.

Comments for this 2018 Yamaha YZ450F:
SUPER CLEAN BIKE, LOTS OF EXTRAS!
2018 Yamaha YZ450F
YOU AND YOUR BIKE - CONNECTED AS ONE.
All-New from the ground up, the YZ450F incorporates electric start, exclusive smartphone app power tuner, new engine, new frame, new slim styling and revised settings to the already industry-best suspension.
Features may include:
Engine
Revised Engine Design
For 2018, the distinct rearward-slanted cylinder design complete with rear exhaust and forward-mounted intake system has been completely updated for 2018. The all-new cylinder head is lighter and is now angled more vertically, to work with the updated frame, for optimized front weight distribution. Inside, the engine features a longer, straighter intake tract, more aggressive cam profiles, a new crankshaft, a stronger, higher-compression box bridge piston design with DLC-coated piston pin, and more. Together, these updates give the rider an ideal balance of open-class power with exceptional controllability.
New Power Tuner App
Breaking new ground in the industry again Yamaha introduces the new Power Tuner app, which brings the power of the GYTR Power Tuner to your iOS or Android device. Using WiFi to connect to the bike's onboard CAN-bus network, the app allows owners to adjust air/fuel mixture and ignition timing maps to tune engine performance for track conditions, record race log information, and monitor a range of data such as maintenance and system diagnosis, engine run time, and more.
New Electric Starter System
The 2018 YZ450F now features a compact electric starter system to minimize restart delays on track and add convenience everywhere else. Powered by a high-capacity and ultra-lightweight four-cell lithium-ion battery, the system adds minimal weight.
Chassis/Suspension
New Aluminum Frame
The 2018 YZ450F compact frame is completely new to further refine the instinctive handling that makes this Yamaha one of the best handling machines in the class. Larger upper frame bracing improves rigidity and durability, while wider rear frame spars and all-new engine mounts centralize mass for the best possible balance of bump absorption, stiffness and feeling of grip.
New Compact Body and Seat Design
The new YZ450F features new bodywork from tip to tail, including a new compact fuel tank specifically designed for motocross demands. In addition to shaving weight, the new body design is narrow for more comfortable knee grip and feeling of control, and the seat is updated to give the rider additional room to move aboard the machine.
Class-Leading Suspension
Industry-leading, fully adjustable KYB coil spring-type fork with speed sensitive damping provides exceptional balance between handling and bump absorption, for race-winning handling performance. The linkage type rear suspension features a KYB shock with revised damping characteristics to match the revised chassis. 2018 features updated internal valving for more controlled damping characteristics.
Additional Features
Adjustable Handlebar Mounts
The 4-position adjustable handlebar mounts are rubber mounted to improve comfort and reduce handlebar vibration, while the handlebar itself is lighter to centralize overall mass.
Embedded Graphics
Yamaha's unique embedded graphics are built into the bodywork for extended durability, resisting both peeling and damage, with all new styling for 2018.
Race Winning Details
The YZ450F includes top-spec details, including 1-1/8 aluminum tapered handlebars, wide 55mm footpegs, a quick-adjust clutch perch, stylish blue rims and gold chain.

2023 Yamaha YZ250F
DOMINATE THE TRACK
The multi-championship-winning YZ250F dominates on the race track, at the shootouts and basically everywhere it goes.
Features may include:
TOP FEATURES
Advanced 250cc Four-Stroke Engine
Featuring a high-spec piston, aggressive cam profiles and reversed cylinder head layout, the YZ250F's advanced four-stroke engine is known for its broad, useable powerband and class-leading low-end and mid-range torque.
Innovative Yamaha Power Tuner App
Yamaha's industry-leading Power Tuner App puts the flexibility and precision tunability of the GYTR Power Tuner into your smartphone. Make fueling and ignition timing changes instantly and upload them to the bike for ultimate track-side tuning. Best of all, it's free-of-charge.
Advanced Bilateral Aluminum Frame
The YZ250F's aluminum bilateral beam frame features main spars, engine mounts and mounting position that are designed to centralize mass and provide an ideal balance between cornering compliance and straight-line stability.
ENGINE
Advanced 250cc Four-Stroke Engine
The YZ250F's liquid-cooled, DOHC 4-valve, fuel-injected powerplant features a forward-positioned straight downdraft intake with symmetrical intake ports, high-spec piston, aggressive cam profiles and reversed cylinder head layout. The advanced four-stroke engine is known for its broad, useable powerband and class-leading low-end and mid-range torque.
Innovative Yamaha Power Tuner App
The free-of-charge Yamaha Power Tuner App brings the power of the GYTR Power Tuner to your iOS or Android device. Using wireless connectivity to talk to the bike's onboard CAN-bus network, the app allows owners to adjust air/fuel mixture and ignition timing maps to tune engine performance for track conditions, record race log information and monitor a range of data such as maintenance and system diagnosis, engine run time and more.
CHASSIS/SUSPENSION
Advanced Bilateral Aluminum Frame
The bilateral aluminum frame features flex characteristics that give riders the ultimate combination of precise cornering performance and handling stability. Large upper frame bracing improves rigidity and durability. The wider rear frame spars, and the YZ250F-specific engine mounts centralize mass for the best possible balance of impact absorption, stiffness and feeling of grip.
Class-Leading Suspension
Fully adjustable KYB coil spring-type fork with speed-sensitive damping delivers exceptional balance between handling and bump absorption for championship-winning performance. The linkage-type rear suspension features a KYB shock optimized to provide less pitch on corner entry/exit and improved stability.
ADDITIONAL FEATURES
Race-Winning Details
The YZ250F boasts top-spec details including 1-1/8-inch aluminum tapered handlebars secured to four-position adjustable handlebar mounts, wide 55mm footpegs, a quick-adjust clutch perch, stylish blue rims and a lightweight gold drive chain.
Simplified Servicing
Sleek air cleaner cover provides tool-free access to the air filter, positioned at the front of the bike to avoid roost from the rear wheel.

A RIDE FOR ALL
Anyone can have access to playgrounds and fun
Experience non-stop thrills
The Can-Am Ryker is all about accessibility, fun times and exploring new playgrounds. Where will you play first?
RYKER PROS
Hear it from the experts
Want to know everything there is to know about the Can-Am Ryker models? From fresh features and packages to brand-new accessories, watch what our pros have to say in our walkaround videos.
RIDE EASY
Whether you're new or a seasoned rider, the Can-Am Ryker was built for you. With an effortless twist-and-go automatic transmission and state-of-the-art technology, you'll feel like a natural on the road.
HAVE A BLAST
The Can-Am Ryker lets your inner child play. With a lower seating position, you'll feel in control and take on every curve. Plus, you can add to the excitement with Sport Mode and Rally Mode on select models!
MAKE IT ALL YOU

Automatic transmission
TWIST & GO

UFit System

2023 Yamaha YZ250X
TWO-STROKE HEART, ENDURO SOUL
Featuring a powerful 250cc two-stroke engine and renowned high performance chassis, the YZ250X was born to win Cross Country races.
Features may include:
TOP FEATURES
Two-Stroke Power: Tuned for Enduro Racing
The YZ250X is optimized for the unique demands of Hare Scrambles and GNCC racing. The Yamaha Power Valve System (YPVS)-equipped 249cc two-stroke engine is mated to a wide-ratio five-speed transmission for the ultimate cross country power plant.
Advanced Motocross-Derived Chassis
Ultra-lightweight YZ250-spec frame features carefully engineered combination of aluminum castings, forgings and extrusions for the perfect balance of rigidity and flex. The industry-leading fully adjustable Speed Sensitive System KYB spring-type front fork is matched with a fully adjustable high performance KYB long-travel rear shock, both tested and tuned specifically for the needs of cross country racers.
ENGINE
Exhilarating Two-Stroke Power
The 249cc liquid-cooled reed-valve-inducted two-stroke engine is lightweight, compact and fun, with an incredibly wide, hard-hitting powerband.
Tuned for GNCC Competition
The YZ250X utilizes a revised compression ratio, revised YPVS timing and a model-specific digital CDI unit compared to its motocross sibling all focused on creating a broad, usable power delivery specifically suited to cross country and enduro-style competition.
CHASSIS/SUSPENSION
YZ250-Based Frame
Ultra-lightweight YZ250-spec frame features carefully engineered combination of aluminum castings, forgings and extrusions for the perfect balance of rigidity and flex. Removable aluminum rear subframe is constructed of square-section tubing for reduced weight.
Industry-Leading KYB Fork
The fully adjustable KYB 48mm forks feature the Speed-Sensitive System which uses piston speed to control the damping force for super-precise handling, superb bump absorption and 11.8 inches of suspension travel. Additionally, a newly adopted scraper between the dust and oil seal improves reliability in cross country conditions.
ADDITIONAL FEATURES
Cross Country Ergonomics
A racy gripper -type seat and narrow fuel tank combined with a tapered aluminum handlebar and adjustable mounts create greater freedom of movement and more comfortable ergonomics for riders.
Cross Country Features
The YZ250X is focused on cross country competition with an 18-inch rear wheel, wide-ratio gearing, standard side stand, sealed O-ring chain, reserve fuel petcock, and newly adopted scraper between the fork's dust and oil seal, all adding up to exceptional cross country performance.
NEW FOR 2023
Improved Rider Ergonomics
To increase rider confidence in challenging cross country conditions, new smoothly integrated body panels, more narrow fuel tank design, slimmer shroud width and flatter seat all combine to enable greater freedom of movement forward and back, allowing the rider to easily shift body weight for better control.
Bold New YZ Styling
Along with the slimmer, more aggressive bodywork, a new front and rear fender design and new radiator shrouds all integrate with a bold new graphics scheme to highlight the YZ family pedigree. Premium Yamaha graphics are now embedded to provide excellent durability and scratch resistance.

2023 Yamaha Zuma 125
COMPACT RUGGED ADVENTURER
The reimagined, ultra-modern, Zuma 125 is a rugged and fuel efficient scooter with big features in a compact package.
Features may include:
TOP FEATURES
Blue Core VVA Engine
Powering the Zuma 125 is a compact Yamaha Blue Core, VVA (Variable Valve Actuation) 125cc 4-stroke engine with 4 valves, a 11.2:1 compression ratio, DiASil cylinder and aluminum alloy forged piston, giving this scooter modern reliability and economical performance. With an amazing 101 mpg and a 1.6 gallon fuel tank, you get plenty of range, too.
Automatic Convenience
A fully-automatic V-belt transmission and push-button electric starting make the Zuma 125 a super-convenient transportation option. Standard center and side stands, along with a locking cover on the ignition switch, make it easy and secure to park, too.
ENGINE
Automatic Convenience
Fully automatic, V-belt transmission with centrifugal clutch provides easy, twist-the-throttle-and-go operation with great off-the-line acceleration.
Clean-Running Design
An upswept muffler incorporates two exhaust catalysts to reduce air pollution and meet emission regulations.
Comfort-Focused Engine Bracket
A reliable steel engine bracket with rubber bushing linkage contributes a comfortable ride with reduced vibration. The link mechanisms are positioned on the underside of the chassis to maximize space for the storage compartment.
CHASSIS/SUSPENSION
Comfortable Ergonomics
A plush and roomy riding position is ready for two, with a narrow seat design for easier flat-footing at stops, and plenty of leg space in front of the rider's seat. Meanwhile, the passenger gets dedicated foldable footrests and secure handholds that blend cleanly into the Zuma 125's body design.
Durable Suspension
The telescopic fork features beefy outer tubes for strength, while fork boots help protect the large 33mm inner tubes from debris. The rear wheel swingarm features twin rear shocks with a full 3.1 in of travel for comfortable riding both on streets and on unpaved roads.
Extensive Fuel Range
The Zuma 125 boasts extreme fuel efficiency carrying the 1.6 gallon fuel tank over a wide cruising range. Its fuel tank emissions system includes a charcoal canister to control gasoline evaporation and reduce air pollution.
Hardy Steel Frame
The robust steel-tube frame is light but strong, and features a step-through design for easy mounting.
ADDITIONAL FEATURES
Modern Gauge Package
The Zuma 125's stylish LCD meter features a fuel gauge as well as a full range of indicator lights with easy-to-read visibility.
Plenty of Storage with USB charging
The cavernous underseat storage compartment is roomy enough for a full-face helmet and features two helmet hangers. The front storage compartment is equipped with an electric USB socket for conveniently charging your device on the go.
Secure and Convenient
The Zuma 125 provides both a centerstand and side stand for parking convenience. For extra security when parked, the main switch is equipped with a keyhole lock cover. And the fuel filler is found just left of the ignition switch for easy refueling.

TOP FEATURES
Advanced Twin-Cylinder Engine
The Tenere 700 features a fuel-injected, 689cc liquid-cooled, inline twin-cylinder engine derived from Yamaha's award-winning MT-07. This compact powerplant features an ideal power delivery for adventure riding, for tractable and controllable power in every riding condition.
Adventure-Focused Ergonomics
The Tenere 700 features a narrow body, slim fuel tank, and flat seat allowing maximum agility, enabling the rider to grip the tank whether sitting or standing, giving added confidence on dirt or asphalt. The protective fairing and handguards work with the tapered handlebar to ensure comfort on the longest rides.
ENGINE
Compact, High-Tech Engine
Developed from the stellar MT-07 Hyper Naked sportbike, the Tenere 700 engine combines exceptional reliability and exciting power delivery in a compact, fuel-efficient package. With an overall size similar to some single-cylinder motors, the 689cc fuel-injected, liquid-cooled, DOHC inline twin gives the Tenere 700 a slim feel for exceptional off-road confidence, while the counterbalanced two-cylinder design provides smooth, long-legged power ideal for long days in the saddle.
Crossplane Crankshaft Concept
The two-cylinder engine features Yamaha's Crossplane Crankshaft Concept 270-degree crank which traces its lineage directly to the Dakar-dominating XTZ750 race bikes to provide linear torque development in response to the rider's throttle input. The CP2 engine is also light, slim and compact, and offers an excellent level of rider/machine communication.
CHASSIS/SUSPENSION
Lightweight Double Cradle Frame Design
A lightweight, high-strength tubular steel frame provides a tuned rigidity balance for nimble, responsive handling with the strength and durability needed to tackle the harshest terrain with confidence. The chassis utilizes a short 62.6-inch wheelbase for agility and boasts 9.5 inches of ground clearance to tackle whatever the trail throws at you.
Balanced Ergonomics
The ability to shift body weight forward and rearward to suit the terrain is crucial in off-road riding situations, so the Tenere 700 features a flat seat and slim body that allows maximum rider agility. The narrow body and fuel tank also enable the rider to grip the tank whether sitting or standing, giving added confidence whether you're riding on dirt or asphalt.
ADDITIONAL FEATURES
Rally-Bred LED Lighting
Echoing the focused, purposeful design of rally-built works racing machines, the Tenere 700 utilizes a clear headlight nacelle with quad LED headlights. This vertically-stacked two-plus-two headlight design provides aggressive looks and excellent visibility, while the LEDs themselves are bright, long-lasting and resistant to shock and vibration.
Protective, Versatile Cockpit
The rally-inspired upper fairing and standard handguards ensure wind and weather protection ideal for long riding days. The taper aluminum handlebar is positioned for a relaxed riding position when sitting or standing on the pegs. The cockpit is also designed to accommodate additional navigation devices, such as a GPS or rally road book.

2023 Yamaha Bolt R-Spec
BORN WITH PERFORMANCE
Featuring a torquey V-Twin engine, this performance bobber combines old-school soul and modern form.
Features may include:
TOP FEATURES
Urban Performance Styling
The Bolt R-Spec is stripped down with minimal chrome, epitomizing the Urban Performance Bobber look. The compact chassis proudly showcases the 58-cubic-inch (942cc) air-cooled 60-degree V-twin powerplant.
Rider-Focused Engine
The Bolt R-Spec uses Yamaha's advanced technology to create a riding experience superior to other similarly sized machines. Fuel injection and ignition timing maps have been chosen specifically for this bike to deliver class-leading performance with strong low- and mid-range torque that's sure to bring a smile to every rider's face.
Compact, Stable Chassis
The slim body and low seat design combine to give the Bolt R-Spec light maneuverability and a stable handling feel. The upright riding posture helps the rider feel the wind, hear the sounds and experience the pulse of the machine.
ENGINE
Air-Cooled V-Twin
The 58-cubic-inch (942cc) engine is an air-cooled SOHC 60-degree V-twin with four valves per cylinder, a pent-roof shaped combustion chamber and 9.0:1 compression ratio. The engine is designed to provide excellent power and superior low-end torque.
Low Friction Internals
Special roller-type rocker arms with needle bearings are used to keep friction loss to a minimum, increase durability and help the engine achieve the ideal performance characteristics.
Advanced Cylinder Design
The pent-roof combustion chamber shape was precisely engineered to direct the fuel/air charge to the center of the piston for more efficient combustion and maximum power. Ceramic-composite plated cylinders provide excellent heat dissipation and reduced oil consumption.
CHASSIS/SUSPENSION
Handling-Focused Frame
A double-cradle frame provides precise handling and enhances city riding enjoyment thanks to the rigid mount system mounting the engine directly to the frame.
Low Seat Height
The low-set seat provides a great riding position while being a mere 27.2 inches off the pavement, so most riders can easily put both feet firmly on the ground at a stop.
Agile Wheelbase
Bolt R-Spec's short, 61.8-inch wheelbase contributes to the bike's great handling, providing precise, tight turns in city riding and solid, stable handling on the open road.
ADDITIONAL FEATURES
Modern Lighting
LED rear taillight looks cool and adds to the modern bobber appeal.
Slick Instruments
Compact digital LCD meter assembly provides clean styling with excellent visibility.
Real Steel Fenders
Steel front and rear fenders are ideal for personalization, including paint and customization.
Bobber-Style Seat
Solo rider saddle adds to the minimalist bobber look while providing support for longer rides.

A RIDE FOR ALL
Anyone can have access to playgrounds and fun
Experience non-stop thrills
The Can-Am Ryker is all about accessibility, fun times and exploring new playgrounds. Where will you play first?
RYKER PROS
Hear it from the experts
Want to know everything there is to know about the Can-Am Ryker models? From fresh features and packages to brand-new accessories, watch what our pros have to say in our walkaround videos.
RIDE EASY
Whether you're new or a seasoned rider, the Can-Am Ryker was built for you. With an effortless twist-and-go automatic transmission and state-of-the-art technology, you'll feel like a natural on the road.
HAVE A BLAST
The Can-Am Ryker lets your inner child play. With a lower seating position, you'll feel in control and take on every curve. Plus, you can add to the excitement with Sport Mode and Rally Mode on select models!
MAKE IT ALL YOU
Hit the streets in style. Your style. With tool-free adjustability, you can change your riding position in seconds. Once you've got it home, it's just as easy to swap the colors of your ride by switching out panels and adding or removing accessories to suit your look.

Vehicle Stability System
READY. STEADY. GO.
ABS, traction & stability control

Its innovative engineering seamlessly harnesses the combined effects and advantages of ABS, plus traction and stability control systems for a safer, more confident ride.
Automatic transmission
TWIST & GO
Effortless shifting
The Can-Am Ryker's automatic transmission delivers effortless twist-and-go shifting designed to keep vehicle performance and fuel efficiency in perfect balance, letting you keep your mind on the road and the adventure ahead.
UFit System
BUILT FOR FUN
Toolless adjustability
No two Can-Am Ryker riders are alike, which is why we've included innovative adjustable ergonomic features, like footpegs and a brake pedal you can position according to your build, and handlebar designs that suit your size. That way your ride always matches your riding style. An industry first, it's quick and simple toolless flexibility that helps customize your fun.

2023 Yamaha TW200
THE DO-IT-ALL DUAL SPORT
Adaptable and comfortable with fat tires, a low seat and a smooth ride makes it a practical do-it-all, dual purpose machine.
Features may include:
Terrain-Conquering Tires
Big fat tires deliver great traction and rider comfort over a wide range of terrain, and they make the TW200 the most distinctive looking dual-purpose machine around.
Low Seat Height
A low seat and compact chassis help inspire confidence in anyone who rides the TW200, making it one of the most user friendly on- and off-road bikes on the market.
Electric Start
Fully equipped for the street or the trail including a worry-free electric start, the TW200 is super convenient to ride just about anywhere you need to go.
ENGINE
Torquey Powerplant
The strong-pulling 196cc air-cooled, four-stroke single delivers torquey low- and mid-range power that's perfectly suited for off-road exploring.
Five-Speed Transmission
A smooth-shifting five-speed transmission with manual clutch puts usable power to the ground for maximum on- and off-road performance.
Smooth, Counterbalanced Engine
An internal engine counterbalancer keeps vibrations down for greater all-day comfort.
Digital Ignition
Maintenance-free CDI ignition system ensures precise, reliable spark for peak engine performance at any rpm.
Electric Start
The push-button electric start makes for easy and reliable starting.
Low Maintenance Engine
Automatic cam chain tensioner means minimal maintenance and longer engine life.
CHASSIS/SUSPENSION
Plush, Long-Travel Suspension
A 33mm telescopic front fork with 6.3 inches of travel soaks up the bumps for a plush ride.
Terrain-Conquering Tires
Fat 130/80-18 front and 180/80-14 rear tires provide excellent traction, and control to make conquering all types of challenging terrain easy and fun.
Lightweight Swingarm
Lightweight box section swingarm and single rear shock with 5.9 inches of travel enhance handling and overall comfort both on- and off-road.
Disc Brake
Hydraulic front disc brake ensures greater stopping power with less effort.
ADDITIONAL
Comfortable Saddle
Long, two-tone, motocross-style seat creates a balanced riding position for optimal rider movement and comfort.
Protective Fenders
The durable and wide front fender keeps water, mud and dirt off the rider.
Passenger-Ready
Spacious seat and passenger foot pegs provide two-up riding capability.
Bright Illumination
Enduro-style, 60/55-watt halogen headlight features high and low beams.
Dual Sport Lighting
Flex-mounted turn indicators offer greater durability against breakage.
Fork Protection
Durable fork shrouds help prevent rocks and debris from damaging fork sliders.
Complete Instruments
Full instrumentation including speedometer, odometer, resettable trip meter, indicator lights for neutral and high beams, plus turn signals come standard.
Modern Battery
Dependable, low-maintenance battery.
